item.title: SRE
item.description: Hope is not a strategy. – SRE saying Two approaches to run a computing system: sysadmin, SRE. Sysadmin approach traditional way assemble existing SW components to produce a service run the service Advantages relatively easy to implement for companies (familiar industry paradigm, lots of examples to emulate, wide talent pool, existing tools and consultants) Disadvantages team size scales linearly with the load generated by the system you end up with two different teams (product developers and product operators) that often live in conflict SRE approach invented by Google (planet-scale products) hire software engineers to run products they create systems that do the work otherwise done by sysadmins Advantages

item.title: Devops
item.description: The opposite of DevOps is despair. – Gene Kim If HW and SW are sufficiently fault tolerant, the remaining problems are human. – TPoCSA CAMS: culture, automation, measurement, and sharing. – D. Edwards, J. Willis (2010) DevOps is a set of techniques to solve the chronic conflict between Development an IT Operations.
